cluster_relations.rel_desc: Evidence is collected from the crime scene.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a piece of forensic evidence is collected from a specified source location such as a crime scene.
remarks: Relation inferred from standard forensic practice described; slightly lower confidence due to implicitness.
Relation inferred from standard forensic practice described; slightly lower confidence due to implicitness.

RelR_f1953fecdfa7 (evidence -> crime scene) and RelR_3ca9b0b9e68b (crime scene -> evidence) represent inverse directions of the same evidence-collection provenance relation. If inverse properties are modeled in the ontology, these two canonical predicates should be declared as inverses and kept in sync.
Relation inferred from standard forensic practice described; slightly lower confidence due to implicitness.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Evidence is collected from the crime scene during forensic work.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a crime scene or location has associated evidence that has been collected from it.

qualifiers.CausalHint: by documenting the details of a crime scene and collecting all relevant evidence

remarks: RelR_f1953fecdfa7 (evidence -> crime scene) and RelR_3ca9b0b9e68b (crime scene -> evidence) represent inverse directions of the same evidence-collection provenance relation. If inverse properties are modeled in the ontology, these two canonical predicates should be declared as inverses and kept in sync.

args.justification: Both relations describe the provenance link between evidence and the crime scene it originates from. This is more accurately categorized as a provenance-oriented relation (source-of-evidence) rather than a generic operational process, so rel_cls_group should be normalized to 'PROVENANCE' while keeping the existing evidence_collection_relation class.
args.remark: These two predicates form an inverse provenance pair (evidence collected_from crime scene vs. crime scene has_collected_evidence evidence); aligning them under the PROVENANCE group improves schema clarity.

executed_decisions.justification: Both relations describe the provenance link between evidence and the crime scene it originates from. This is more accurately categorized as a provenance-oriented relation (source-of-evidence) rather than a generic operational process, so rel_cls_group should be normalized to 'PROVENANCE' while keeping the existing evidence_collection_relation class.
executed_decisions.remark: These two predicates form an inverse provenance pair (evidence collected_from crime scene vs. crime scene has_collected_evidence evidence); aligning them under the PROVENANCE group improves schema clarity.
